top_content.subtitle: Bridging Geospatial Technology and Humanity
top_content.paragraph_1: FOSS4G is the world’s largest conference dedicated to open-source geospatial software, organized by the OSGeo Foundation based in the United States. In 2026, this global FOSS4G event will be held in Hiroshima, Japan.
top_content.paragraph_2: Geospatial technology empowers communities to address real-world challenges such as disaster response, urban planning, and environmental resilience.
top_content.paragraph_3: At FOSS4G Hiroshima 2026, we will further highlight the humanitarian applications of open-source geospatial technologies — from supporting refugees to preserving cultural memory.
top_content.paragraph_4: As a “City of Peace and Reconstruction,” Hiroshima is an ideal place to explore how technology can foster empathy, inclusion, and international collaboration.
top_content.paragraph_5: And of course, we invite you to enjoy Hiroshima’s unique culture and delicious cuisine to the fullest.

foss4g.title: About FOSS4G
foss4g.intro: FOSS4G is an acronym for Free and Open Source Software for Geospatial, and it represents the world's largest international conference organized by OSGeo, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting open-source GIS. This conference, held in various locations around the world, attracts over 1,000 participants annually and has evolved into the flagship event representing the geospatial community.

hiroshima_section.title: FOSS4G 2026 Comes to Hiroshima
hiroshima_section.content: In 2026, FOSS4G will be held in Hiroshima, Japan. In this city that symbolizes peace, advocates of "free and open" geospatial information from around the world will gather. Let us expand the possibilities of open-source GIS together here in Hiroshima.

knowledge_section.title: Convergence of All Geospatial Knowledge
knowledge_section.intro: FOSS4G covers a wide range of topics including:
topics: Geospatial tool use cases and applications
knowledge_section.conclusion: It serves as a platform where participants with diverse expertise and backgrounds learn from each other and share the latest insights.

participation_section.title: Open to Everyone
participation_section.intro: FOSS4G is an event for everyone interested in maps. We welcome not only developers who write code, but also GIS users, decision-makers, researchers, students, and even beginners who are "just a little curious."
participation_section.community: Nearly 1,000 people participate in FOSS4G each year, and this community continues to grow. Whether you are a geospatial information professional or attending for the first time, as long as you have an "open mind," FOSS4G is your place.

closing_section.title: See You at FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima!
closing_section.content: Let us create the future of free and open geospatial together. We look forward to welcoming you in Hiroshima.

co_chair_1.name: Dr. Sample Name
co_chair_1.description: Brief description of the organizer's background and role in FOSS4G community.

co_chair_2.name: Prof. Sample Name
co_chair_2.description: Brief description of the organizer's background and role in FOSS4G community.

program_chair.name: Dr. Sample Name
program_chair.description: Brief description of the organizer's background and role in FOSS4G community.

organizing_committee.title: Organizing Committee
organizing_committee.description_1: The FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima organizing committee consists of dedicated volunteers from the Japanese and international geospatial community. Our team brings together expertise in open source geospatial technologies, event management, and local knowledge of Hiroshima.
organizing_committee.description_2: Detailed information about all organizing committee members will be updated as the conference approaches.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.paragraph_1: At FOSS4G Hiroshima 2026, we explore how open-source geospatial technologies can serve humanity's greatest challenges. As a "City of Peace and Reconstruction," Hiroshima provides the perfect backdrop to examine technology's role in fostering empathy, inclusion, and international collaboration.
vision.paragraph_2: Geospatial technology empowers communities to address real-world challenges such as disaster response, urban planning, and environmental resilience. At FOSS4G Hiroshima 2026, we will further highlight the humanitarian applications of open-source geospatial technologies — from supporting refugees to preserving cultural memory.

hiroshima.title: Why Hiroshima?
hiroshima.paragraph_1: Hiroshima's commitment to peace and international understanding aligns perfectly with the open-source philosophy of collaboration and shared knowledge.
hiroshima.paragraph_2: In this special place, let us discuss together how geospatial technology can contribute to a more peaceful, sustainable, and intricately connected world, and what the future holds.

logo.title: Conference Logo
logo.description: The FOSS4G Hiroshima 2026 logo embodies our wish for the coexistence of technology and humanity.
logo.paragraph_1: The intricate and delicate lines depicted in the logo are inspired by the fold marks of the "origami crane," beloved in Japan as a symbol of peace. These lines form shapes that symbolize the "connections" and "expansions" inherent in geospatial technology, while reflecting the message of peace that Hiroshima continues to send to the world. The color scheme adopts red, which symbolizes Japan and Hiroshima.
logo.paragraph_2: The origami crane is also known from the story that "folding a thousand cranes will grant your wish," and is cherished by many as a symbol of prayer, hope, and solidarity.
logo.conclusion: The gathering of people from around the world at FOSS4G Hiroshima 2026 will, like a thousand paper cranes that bundle together many people's wishes, create the power to connect technology and humanity and shape a new future together.

commitment.title: Our Commitment
commitment.content: FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima is committed to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion, or technology choices.

expected_behavior.title: Expected Behavior
items: Participate in an authentic and active way
Exercise consideration and respect in your speech and actions
Refrain from demeaning, discriminatory, or harassing behavior and speech
Be mindful of your surroundings and of your fellow participants

unacceptable_behavior.title: Unacceptable Behavior
items: Intimidating, harassing, abusive, discriminatory, derogatory or demeaning speech or actions
Sexual language and imagery in any conference venue
Harmful or prejudicial verbal or written comments related to gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, disability
Inappropriate use of nudity and/or sexual images
Real or implied threat of professional or personal damage
Inappropriate disruption of presentations or other conference events

consequences.title: Consequences
consequences.content: Anyone asked to stop unacceptable behavior is expected to comply immediately. Conference organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender or expulsion from the conference without refund.

reporting.title: Reporting
reporting.intro: If you are subject to or witness unacceptable behavior, or have any other concerns, please notify a conference organizer as soon as possible.
reporting.confidentiality: All reports will be handled with discretion and confidentiality.

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.intro: This Privacy Policy describes how FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima collects, uses, and protects your personal information.

information_collect.title: Information We Collect
items: Registration information (name, email, affiliation, dietary requirements)
Payment information (processed securely through third-party providers)

data_protection.title: Data Protection
data_protection.content: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. Your data is stored securely and accessed only by authorized personnel.

registration_terms.title: Registration Terms
registration_terms.intro: By registering for FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima, you agree to the following terms and conditions:

payment_refunds.title: Payment and Refunds
items: Full payment is required at the time of registration
Refunds are available according to our cancellation policy
No refunds will be issued for no-shows
Registration fees are non-transferable between individuals

cancellation_policy.title: Cancellation Policy
cancellation_policy.link_text: For detailed cancellation policy and refund terms, please refer to our

conference_participation.title: Conference Participation
items: Attendees must comply with the conference code of conduct
Photography and recording may occur during sessions
Presentation materials may be shared publicly
Conference organizers reserve the right to modify the program

liability.title: Liability
liability.content: FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima organizers are not liable for any personal injury, loss, or damage to property that may occur during the conference. Attendees participate at their own risk.

force_majeure.title: Force Majeure
force_majeure.content: In the event of circumstances beyond our control (natural disasters, government restrictions, etc.), the conference may be postponed, cancelled, or moved to a virtual format. Refund policies will be communicated in such cases.

important_note.title: Important Note
important_note.content: These terms are preliminary and subject to change. Final terms and conditions will be provided during the registration process in 2026.

cancellation.title: Cancellation Policy

steps: Include your registration confirmation number and reason for cancellation
Receive cancellation confirmation within 3 business days
Refund processed within 14 business days of confirmation

medical_emergency.title: Medical Emergency
medical_emergency.description: Full refund available with medical documentation, regardless of cancellation date. Medical certificate must be provided within 30 days of the conference.

visa_denial.title: Visa Denial
visa_denial.description: Full refund available for international attendees whose visa applications are denied. Official visa denial documentation required.

force_majeure.title: Force Majeure
force_majeure.description: In case of conference cancellation due to circumstances beyond our control (natural disasters, government restrictions, etc.), refund policies will be communicated separately based on the specific situation.

registration_transfer.title: Registration Transfer
registration_transfer.description: Registrations may be transferred to another person under the following conditions:
conditions: Transfer request must be made before August 1, 2026
New attendee must meet the same registration category requirements
Both original and new attendee must confirm the transfer in writing

workshop_cancellations.title: Workshop Cancellations
workshop_cancellations.description: Workshop registrations follow the same refund schedule as conference registration.
workshop_cancellations.note: Note: If a workshop is cancelled by the organizers, full refund will be provided for the workshop fee, regardless of the cancellation date.

no_show_policy.title: No-Show Policy
no_show_policy.warning: Important: No refunds will be issued for no-shows. If you cannot attend, please cancel your registration according to the policy above.

contact_information.title: Contact Information
contact_information.note: Please allow 3-5 business days for email responses during peak registration periods.

topics.title: General Session Topics
topics.intro: We welcome presentations on all aspects of open-source geospatial technologies, including but not limited to:

academic_track.title: Academic Track
academic_track.description: Details about academic paper submissions and presentations.
academic_track.coming_soon_message: Academic Track submissions will open in December 2025

overview.title: Academic Track Overview
overview.description: The Academic Track at FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima provides a platform for researchers to present peer-reviewed scientific contributions to the open-source geospatial community. We welcome high-quality research papers that advance the state of knowledge in geospatial science and technology.

short_papers.title: Short Papers
short_papers.description: 4-6 pages, preliminary results or position papers

review_process.title: Review Process
items: Double-blind peer review by at least 3 reviewers
Review criteria: novelty, technical quality, significance, clarity
Accepted papers will be published in conference proceedings
Best paper awards will be presented at the conference

formatting_requirements.title: Formatting Requirements
items: Papers must be written in English
Use the provided LaTeX or Word template
All figures and tables must be of high quality
References must follow the specified citation style

publication.title: Publication
publication.description: Accepted papers will be published in the FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima Conference Proceedings, which will be made available as open access. Selected high-quality papers may be invited for submission to a special issue of a relevant journal.

program_committee.title: Program Committee
program_committee.description: The Academic Track Program Committee consists of renowned researchers from academia and industry. Committee members will be announced when the call for papers opens.

workshop_proposals.title: Workshop Proposals
workshop_proposals.coming_soon_message: Workshop proposals will open in January 2026

overview.title: Workshop Overview
overview.description: FOSS4G 2026 Hiroshima workshops provide hands-on learning experiences with open-source geospatial tools and technologies. We invite proposals for half-day and full-day workshops that offer practical, interactive sessions for conference attendees.

proposal_requirements.title: Proposal Requirements
requirements: Title and Abstract: Clear, descriptive title and 250-word abstract
Learning Objectives: 3-5 specific learning outcomes
Target Audience: Skill level and background requirements
Detailed Agenda: Hour-by-hour schedule with activities
Technical Requirements: Software, hardware, and data needs
Instructor Bio: Qualifications and teaching experience
Previous Experience: Past workshop delivery record

selection_criteria.title: Selection Criteria
selection_criteria.intro: Proposals will be evaluated based on:
criteria: Quality of content and learning objectives (25%)

contact.title: Ready to Propose a Workshop?
contact.note: We're here to help you create an amazing learning experience!

what_is_code_sprint.description: Code Sprints are collaborative coding events where developers, users, and contributors work together on open-source geospatial projects. These intensive sessions foster innovation, fix bugs, implement new features, and strengthen the FOSS4G community.

participating_projects.intro: We welcome proposals from established FOSS4G projects. Priority will be given to projects that:
